alert.note: Alert for Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 23 at 12:19PM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and/or snowmelt and/or ice jam continues. * WHERE...A portion of southern Vermont, including the town of Woodstock in Windsor County. * WHEN...Until 430 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1214 PM EST, Woodstock Fire and Rescue reported an ice jam and localized flooding due to an ice jam along the Ottauquechee River at the Lincoln Covered Bridge. Flooding is ongoing with Bridges and Fletcher Hill Roads closed due to high water. High water is also impacting US Route 4 East, but the road remains open to travel. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Woodstock and West Woodstock, especially near the Lincoln Covered Bridge. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Obey all road closure signs. They are there for your safety.
